alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 08 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... The Flood Watch is now in effect for * a portion of South Florida, including the following areas, Coastal Broward, Coastal Miami-Dade, Metro Broward, and Metro Miami-Dade. * Through Thursday evening * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Recent rainfall accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with isolated amounts up to 5 inches have fallen over the metro areas since early Tuesday on top of the 8 to 15 inches over last weekend have led to saturated ground across coastal and metro Miami- Dade and Broward Counties. Additional excessive rainfall possible through Thursday could lead to additional flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
